required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Household Purchasing Patterns, Eating and Recreation
clinical_study.official_title: Delay Discounting and Household Food Choices

brief_summary.textblock: This project examines behavioral and household characteristics associated with food purchasing patterns.

primary_outcome.measure: Diet Quality of Household Food Purchases
primary_outcome.description: Diet quality was quantified by applying the Healthy Eating Index-2015 (HEI-2015) scoring criteria (https://epi.grants.cancer.gov/hei/) to the nutrient and food group data of purchased foods and beverages. The HEI-2015 scores adherence to the Department of Health and Human Services' 2015 Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Adherence to recommended intakes for 13 key dietary components is scored on continuous scale for each component, and the 13 component scores are then summed to obtain a total score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect closer adherence to the dietary guidelines.

secondary_outcome.description: Diet quality was quantified by applying the Healthy Eating Index-2015 (HEI-2015) scoring criteria (https://epi.grants.cancer.gov/hei/) to the nutrient and food group data derived from three 24-hour diet recalls. The HEI-2015 scores adherence to the Department of Health and Human Services' 2015 Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Adherence to recommended intakes for 13 key dietary components is scored on continuous scale for each component, and the 13 component scores are then summed to obtain a total score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect closer adherence to the dietary guidelines.

Availability of obesity promoting foods in the home, assessed with an audit-based inventory. The audit captures the presence of 71 "obesity promoting" foods. The sum of these items ranges from 0-71, with higher scores reflecting greater availability in the home.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Total Energy Purchased From Non-store Sources (e.g., Fast Food and Take-out/Delivery, Restaurants)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of total energy (kcal) purchased from all sources other than food stores/supermarkets, including fast food and take-out/delivery, full-service restaurants, vending machines, bars/taverns, and cafeterias.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at 12 Months
Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index at 12 Months
other_outcome.description: Change in body mass index over 12 months of follow up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult individual who reports making at least 75% of household food purchases
2. Resides in City of Chicago, Illinois or surrounding suburbs
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Inability to provide informed consent in English
2. Living in transitional housing or on a college campus
3. Lack of a cellular or land line phone
4. Gang presence or illegal activity in the immediate vicinity of the home, or other factors jeopardizing researcher safety during home visits (e.g., extreme unsanitary conditions)
5. Having a household member, including the primary shopper, with a medical condition or food allergy that substantially influences household food choices (e.g., phenylketonuria, celiac disease)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Delay discounting
measure.description: Area under the curve of delay discounting indifference points for hypothetical monetary rewards, on scale from 0-100.

measure.title: Systolic blood pressure
measure.description: Systolic blood pressure taken in triplicate, at rest in seated position.

outcome.title: Diet Quality of Household Food Purchases
outcome.description: Diet quality was quantified by applying the Healthy Eating Index-2015 (HEI-2015) scoring criteria (https://epi.grants.cancer.gov/hei/) to the nutrient and food group data of purchased foods and beverages. The HEI-2015 scores adherence to the Department of Health and Human Services' 2015 Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Adherence to recommended intakes for 13 key dietary components is scored on continuous scale for each component, and the 13 component scores are then summed to obtain a total score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect closer adherence to the dietary guidelines.
outcome.population: N=202 participants had food purchase data available for analysis.

Adherence to recommended intakes for 13 key dietary components is scored on continuous scale for each component, and the 13 component scores are then summed to obtain a total score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect closer adherence to the dietary guidelines.
measure.population: N=202 participants had food purchase data available for analysis.

Adherence to recommended intakes for 13 key dietary components is scored on continuous scale for each component, and the 13 component scores are then summed to obtain a total score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect closer adherence to the dietary guidelines.

outcome.description: Availability of obesity promoting foods in the home, assessed with an audit-based inventory. The audit captures the presence of 71 "obesity promoting" foods. The sum of these items ranges from 0-71, with higher scores reflecting greater availability in the home.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at 12 Months
outcome.population: N=179 participants had blood pressure readings at both baseline and the 12-month follow up.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at 12 Months
measure.population: N=179 participants had blood pressure readings at both baseline and the 12-month follow up.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index at 12 Months
outcome.description: Change in body mass index over 12 months of follow up
outcome.population: N=180 participants completed the 12-month follow up assessment

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index at 12 Months
measure.description: Change in body mass index over 12 months of follow up
measure.population: N=180 participants completed the 12-month follow up assessment

reported_events.desc: As this was an observational study, adverse events were not defined in advance. All-cause mortality, serious, and other adverse events were not monitored.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
